snippet.title: The Irate Gamer Game - iOS Gameplay
snippet.description:
Just testing out a screen recording app on my iPhone by playing this "game". There are some audio issues because I was tinkering with the volume on the fly (it would only record the sound from the phone's mic, so I had to use loud headphones to get the sound working properly in the recording).

Anyway, for those who do not know, this is the demo version of The Irate Gamer Game (or "TIGG", as it is referred to on the App Store; searching "Irate Gamer" won't get you the right results). This video only shows the first two levels (plus a bonus death in level 3 for the lulz). I might do videos of more levels in the future.

It's a mediocre game at best: suffering from strange physics, bland gameplay, and forgettable music. However, the artwork is somewhat decent, although the Irate Gamer himself has a goofy walking animation and looks like he's scratching his butt when he jumps. I only played it for shits and giggles (and to see Bores' attempt at a "game") but other than that, it's not really worth it.


Incidentally, if you listen carefully around 2:14, you can hear me struggle to hold back laughter at the cringey way Bores says "awesome" upon completing the stage.
